timeline.bodyText: Looks like we are just setting the tenant id on the audience -- whatever audience was created; which may not be correct in the first place i.e. not having any audience in the config defaults to AllAccounts. I think we need to make sure the the audience on the Authority is of the correct type.
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: (both tenant name and tenant id work interchangeably. Although setting a tenant name here in the tenantID field could be misleading. I could rename that field in audience to "setTenant()" if that makes more sense.)
replies.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText:
We should be able to by splitting the URL in parts and checking the last segment and create the following mapping:

/common - AllAccounts
/organizations - AnyOrganizationalAccount
/consumers - AnyPersonalAccount
/tenantId (or tenantName) - AccountsInOneOrganization

and then we can initialize the authority object with the correct audience
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: ah ok. makes sense. will do.
replies.author: rpdome
